metadata.description: Burndown chart scenarios with pattern recognition exercises

scenarios.title: The Staircase Pattern
scenarios.description: Team completing work in large chunks rather than continuously

symptoms: Flat periods followed by steep drops
Stories not broken down small enough
root_causes: Not breaking work into daily tasks

questions.question: What does this burndown pattern indicate?
questions.explanation: The staircase pattern shows work being completed in large chunks, indicating stories aren't broken down into daily-sized tasks

questions.question: What's the best intervention for this pattern?
questions.explanation: Breaking stories into smaller, daily-completable tasks would create smoother burndown progress

scenarios.title: The Scope Creep Pattern
scenarios.description: Work being added mid-sprint causing the burndown to go up

questions.question: What happened on day 5 of this sprint?
options: Work was added to the sprint
questions.explanation: The burndown went up from 23 to 28 points, indicating 5 points of work was added mid-sprint

questions.question: What should the Scrum Master do immediately?
questions.explanation: The Scrum Master should protect the sprint scope and help defer new work to the next sprint

scenarios.title: The Blocked Team Pattern
scenarios.description: Team unable to make progress due to external dependencies

questions.question: When did the team get blocked?
questions.explanation: The burndown flatlined from day 4-7, indicating the team was blocked during this period

questions.question: Will this team likely meet their sprint goal?
options: No, they'll miss by a lot
No, they'll miss by a little
questions.explanation: They'll finish with 6 points remaining out of 42, missing by about 14% - a small miss

ideal.team_behavior: Well-planned work, good collaboration, no major blockers

staircase.description: Work completed in large chunks with flat periods
staircase.team_behavior: Stories too large, not breaking work into daily tasks

scope_creep.description: Burndown line goes up due to added work

early_finish.team_behavior: Conservative planning, efficient execution, or simple work

daily_standup.staircase: Focus on breaking down current work into daily tasks
daily_standup.scope_creep: Discuss new requests and protect sprint scope
daily_standup.blocked: Escalate blockers and identify alternative work

mid_sprint.scope_creep: Meet with product owner about scope changes
mid_sprint.blocked: Escalate to management, consider scope adjustment

retrospective.staircase: Discuss story sizing and task breakdown practices
retrospective.scope_creep: Review sprint planning and stakeholder communication
retrospective.blocked: Identify dependency patterns and prevention strategies
retrospective.late_start: Examine team motivation and work prioritization
